trailingComments.value: If the `title` attribute is set to null or false, we don't want to give the
avatar a title. On the other hand, if it hasn't been given at all, we can
safely default it to the user's username.

leadingComments.value: If the `title` attribute is set to null or false, we don't want to give the
avatar a title. On the other hand, if it hasn't been given at all, we can
safely default it to the user's username.

trailingComments.value: If a user has been passed, then we will set up an avatar using their
uploaded image, or the first letter of their username if they haven't

leadingComments.value: If a user has been passed, then we will set up an avatar using their
uploaded image, or the first letter of their username if they haven't

*
 * The `avatar` helper displays a user's avatar.
 *
 * @param {User} user
 * @param {Object} attrs Attributes to apply to the avatar element
 * @return {Object}

 * @return {Object}

comments.value:
*
 * The `avatar` helper displays a user's avatar.
 *
 * @param {User} user
 * @param {Object} attrs Attributes to apply to the avatar element
 * @return {Object}
If the `title` attribute is set to null or false, we don't want to give the
avatar a title. On the other hand, if it hasn't been given at all, we can
safely default it to the user's username.
If a user has been passed, then we will set up an avatar using their
uploaded image, or the first letter of their username if they haven't
